content:
ianity.
I assume that by ‘God’ Christians generally mean an eternal, personal,
first  cause  of  the  universe,  who  has  infinite  perfections—omnipotence,
omniscience, perfect goodness, and so on—andwho has revealed himself
to man in the Christian scriptures. The idea of God as an eternal, personal,
first cause of the universe, possessing all perfections, is common not only
in Christianity, but also in Judaism and Islam. I take it that the most impor-
tant thing which distinguishes Christiant
